ground_truth: All is quiet as Frodo peers uneasily into the darkened living room when suddenly a large figure looms out of the shadows, reaching for him. Frodo lets out a startled cry, pulls himself free, and spins around to face his assailant as Gandalf steps into a shaft of moonlight with paranoia blazing in his eyes. Gandalf's clothes are dirty and ragged from much traveling, and his hair and beard are much longer and unkempt; he is suspicious and alert. Frodo pulls the envelope out of an old chest, and without a word, Gandalf takes the envelope and tosses it into the fireplace. Flames instantly consume the envelope, revealing the ring as it sinks into the red hot embers. Gandalf reaches into the fire with a pair of tongs, lifts the ring out, and drops it into Frodo's hand, who reacts to its weight. The gold band of the ring has fiery letters that begin to appear, and a tiny inscription glows red as if burning from within, emanating from the ring. Frodo looks at Gandalf, each knowing the other has heard it: Mordor. The ring lies between them on the table as Gandalf looks at Frodo, sadly. A teasing glimpse shows Gollum being tortured by the Orcs. On a dark country lane, a Hobbit bounder lifts his watch lantern in alarm as two Black Riders thunder out of the darkness, and a lethal sword swings down at the small Hobbit bounder. Frodo thrusts the ring at Gandalf as he throws clothes into a knapsack, and Gandalf watches him, making plans. Frodo is preparing to leave, and Gandalf looks at the young hobbit, moved by his courage. Gandalf freezes and moves quietly towards the window, eyes wide with tension, as he raises his staff above the window and slams it down on the intruder, resulting in a yelp of pain. Gandalf hauls a small figure into the room, revealing Sam Gamgee sprawled across the floor, looking up in terror as Gandalf looms over him. Hobbiton is shrouded in a white veil of mist, revealing Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam hurrying across a ploughed field, away from Hobbiton. Gandalf leads his horse as Frodo and Sam are carrying knapsacks, guiding them under the cover of woods. Gandalf takes Frodo to one side, and Frodo nods, patting his pocket. Frodo and Sam hike over the gentle Shire countryside, wading through a shallow stream. Sam stops short, taking stock of his surroundings, then takes a deep breath and steps forward, his brown, furry foot hitting the ground as Frodo and Sam continue their journey. Meanwhile, Gandalf is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient forest of Fangorn. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Misty Mountains, the tall black tower of Orthanc is clearly visible as Gandalf gallops through the gate into the fortress of Isengard, a great ring-wall of stone, a mile from rim to rim, enclosing beautiful trees and gardens, watered by streams that flow down from the mountains.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: All is tranquil as Frodo gazes uneasily into the dimmed parlor when abruptly a sizable silhouette emerges out of the shadows, reaching for him. Frodo lets out a startled shout, pulls himself free, and rotates around to face his attacker as Gandalf strides into a beam of moonlight with paranoia blazing in his eyes. Gandalf's garments are dirty and tattered from much journeying, and his hair and beard are much extended and disheveled; he is wary and vigilant. Frodo extracts the envelope out of an old chest, and without a word, Gandalf takes the envelope and hurls it into the hearth. Flames instantly devour the envelope, unveiling the ring as it sinks into the scarlet hot embers. Gandalf reaches into the fire with a pair of pincers, lifts the ring out, and drops it into Frodo's palm, who reacts to its heft. The gold circle of the ring has fiery characters that begin to surface, and a tiny engraving glows red as if burning from within, emanating from the ring. Frodo glances at Gandalf, each knowing the other has heard it: Mordor. The ring lies between them on the table as Gandalf gazes at Frodo, sorrowfully. A mocking glimpse shows Gollum being tortured by the Orcs. On a dark rural lane, a Hobbit bounder lifts his watch lantern in alarm as two Black Riders thunder out of the darkness, and a lethal blade swings down at the small Hobbit bounder. Frodo thrusts the ring at Gandalf as he throws garments into a rucksack, and Gandalf observes him, making plans. Frodo is preparing to depart, and Gandalf gazes at the young hobbit, moved by his bravery. Gandalf freezes and moves silently towards the window, eyes wide with tension, as he raises his staff above the window and slams it down on the intruder, resulting in a yelp of pain. Gandalf hauls a small figure into the room, revealing Sam Gamgee sprawled across the floor, looking up in terror as Gandalf looms over him. Hobbiton is shrouded in a white veil of fog, revealing Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam hurrying across a ploughed field, away from Hobbiton. Gandalf leads his steed as Frodo and Sam are carrying rucksacks, guiding them under the cover of woods. Gandalf takes Frodo to one side, and Frodo nods, patting his pocket. Frodo and Sam trek over the gentle Shire countryside, wading through a shallow brook. Sam halts short, surveying his surroundings, then takes a deep breath and steps forward, his brown, furry foot hitting the ground as Frodo and Sam continue their voyage. Meanwhile, Gandalf is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient woodland of Fangorn. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Misty Mountains, the tall black spire of Orthanc is clearly visible as Gandalf gallops through the gateway into the stronghold of Isengard, a great ring-wall of stone, a mile from rim to rim, enclosing beautiful trees and gardens, watered by streams that flow down from the peaks.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: All is kept quiet by Frodo as he peers uneasily into the darkened living room when suddenly a large figure is loomed out of the shadows, reaching for him. A startled cry is let out by Frodo, he pulls himself free, and spins around to face his assailant as Gandalf steps into a shaft of moonlight with paranoia blazing in his eyes. Gandalf's clothes are made dirty and ragged from much traveling, and his hair and beard are grown much longer and unkempt; suspicion and alertness characterize him. The envelope is pulled by Frodo out of an old chest, and without a word, the envelope is taken by Gandalf and tossed into the fireplace. The envelope is instantly consumed by flames, revealing the ring as it sinks into the red hot embers. With a pair of tongs, Gandalf reaches into the fire, lifts the ring out, and drops it into Frodo's hand, who reacts to its weight. Fiery letters are observed beginning to appear on the gold band of the ring as a tiny inscription glows red as if burning from within, emanating from the ring. Frodo looks at Gandalf, each one knowing the other has heard it: Mordor. On the table, the ring is lying between them as Frodo is looked at by Gandalf, sadly. A teasing glimpse shows Gollum being tortured by the Orcs. On a dark country lane, a watch lantern is lifted by a Hobbit bounder in alarm as two Black Riders thunder out of the darkness, and a lethal sword is swung down at the small Hobbit bounder. The ring is thrust by Frodo at Gandalf as clothes are thrown by him into a knapsack, and Gandalf watches him, making plans. Frodo is preparing to leave, and the young hobbit is looked at by Gandalf, who is moved by his courage. Gandalf freezes, and he quietly moves towards the window, eyes wide with tension, as his staff is raised above the window and slammed down on the intruder, a yelp of pain resulting. A small figure is hauled by Gandalf into the room, revealing Sam Gamgee sprawled across the floor, looking up in terror as Gandalf looms over him. Hobbiton is shrouded in a white veil of mist, revealing Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam hurrying across a ploughed field, away from Hobbiton. Gandalf leads his horse as Frodo and Sam carry knapsacks and guide them under the cover of woods. Frodo is taken to one side by Gandalf, and by patting his pocket, Frodo nods. Over the gentle Shire countryside, Frodo and Sam are hiking, wading through a shallow stream. Sam stops short, takes stock of his surroundings, then takes a deep breath and steps forward, his brown, furry foot hitting the ground as Frodo and Sam continue their journey. Meanwhile, the outskirts of the ancient forest of Fangorn are being galloped along by Gandalf. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Misty Mountains, the tall black tower of Orthanc is clearly visible, and through the gate into the fortress of Isengard, Gandalf gallops, a great ring-wall of stone, a mile from rim to rim, enclosing beautiful trees and gardens, watered by streams that flow down from the mountains.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The quiet is disrupted as Frodo peers into the dark living room, startled by a large figure reaching for him. He spins around, and Gandalf steps into the moonlight, dirty and ragged from travel, with suspicion in his eyes. Frodo retrieves the envelope, which Gandalf wordlessly throws into the fire, revealing the ring in the embers. Gandalf uses tongs to hand it to Frodo, who reacts to its weight. Fiery letters and an inscription glow red on the ring, and both hear: Mordor. The ring sits on the table between them. Gollum is seen tortured by Orcs. On a dark lane, a Hobbit bounder's alarm rises as Black Riders approach, swinging a sword. Frodo thrusts the ring at Gandalf while packing a knapsack; Gandalf watches, moved by Frodo's courage. Gandalf tenses at the window, slams his staff down, and hauls in a terrified Sam Gamgee. Hobbiton lies in mist as Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam hurry away, with Gandalf leading his horse. Frodo nods at Gandalf, patting his pocket. Frodo and Sam trek across the Shire, with Sam pausing to take a breath before continuing. Meanwhile, Gandalf rides along Fangorn Forest, reaching the black tower of Orthanc at Isengard, enclosed by a vast stone wall, streams, and gardens.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Frodo peers into the dark living room when a large figure emerges, grabbing for him. Startled, Frodo breaks free and turns to see Gandalf in moonlight, paranoid. Gandalf, scruffy from travel, takes an envelope from Frodo, tosses it into the fire, revealing the ring with fiery letters glowing. Both hear "Mordor." The ring lies on the table between them. Gollum is glimpsed being tortured by Orcs. On a lane, a Hobbit guard is attacked by Black Riders. Frodo gives Gandalf the ring as he packs. Gandalf watches, moved by Frodo's courage. Hearing an intruder, Gandalf strikes and discovers Sam Gamgee. Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam hurry away from misty Hobbiton, carrying knapsacks. Gandalf talks with Frodo, who nods, patting his pocket. Frodo and Sam trek, with Sam hesitating before stepping forward. Gandalf rides near Fangorn's edge, entering Isengard, a fortress with gardens and streams, at the foot of the Misty Mountains.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: In the stillness and absolute quiet of the room, Frodo peers uneasily into the darkened living room, where the silence is suddenly shattered as a large figure unexpectedly looms out from the shadows, reaching ominously for him. With a startled cry escaping his lips, Frodo quickly pulls himself free and swiftly spins around to face his unknown assailant. It is at this precise moment that Gandalf steps into a shaft of pale moonlight, paranoia blazing fiercely in his sharp eyes. Gandalf's clothes are dusty, dirty, and ragged from many long days of arduous travel, and his hair and beard have grown much longer and more unkempt, giving him a suspicious and alert appearance. Frodo retrieves the envelope from an old chest without uttering a single word, and Gandalf, with a swift motion, takes it from him and tosses it purposefully into the fireplace. Instantly, flames leap up to devour the envelope, and as it sinks into the red-hot embers, the ring is revealed. With a pair of tongs, Gandalf reaches into the blazing fire, carefully lifts the ring out, and drops it into Frodo’s hand, who reacts to the surprising weight of the object. The gold band of the ring bears fiery letters that begin to appear as a tiny inscription glows red, as if burning from within, emanating a menacing aura. Frodo and Gandalf exchange a meaningful glance, each knowing the other has heard the menacing name: Mordor. The ring lies ominously between them on the table as Gandalf gazes at Frodo, sadness evident in his expression. In a fleeting, teasing glimpse, Gollum is shown being tortured by the Orcs. Meanwhile, on a dark and foreboding country lane, a Hobbit bounder lifts his watch lantern in alarm as two Black Riders suddenly thunder out of the darkness, and a lethal sword swings down at the small Hobbit bounder. As the threat looms, Frodo thrusts the ring towards Gandalf while frantically throwing clothes into a waiting knapsack. Gandalf watches him carefully, already making plans. As Frodo prepares to embark on his journey, Gandalf looks at the young hobbit, deeply moved by his courage. Suddenly, Gandalf freezes and moves quietly toward the window, eyes wide with tension, as he raises his staff high above the window and brings it down forcefully on the intruder, resulting in a yelp of pain. He hauls a small, familiar figure into the room, revealing Sam Gamgee sprawled across the floor, looking up in sheer terror as Gandalf looms over him. Hobbiton is shrouded in a thick white veil of mist, revealing Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam hurriedly making their way across a ploughed field, putting distance between themselves and Hobbiton. Gandalf leads his horse as Frodo and Sam, each carrying knapsacks, make their way under the protective cover of the woods. Taking Frodo to one side, Gandalf offers words of guidance, and Frodo nods in understanding, patting his pocket reassuringly. Together, Frodo and Sam hike over the gentle, rolling hills of the Shire countryside, their journey taking them through a shallow stream, Sam stopping short to take stock of his surroundings before taking a deep breath and stepping forward, his brown, furry foot landing on solid ground once more. Meanwhile, Gandalf is galloping swiftly along the outskirts of the ancient, dense forest of Fangorn. Nestled within a basin at the foot of the distant, imposing Misty Mountains, the tall black tower of Orthanc stands clearly visible as Gandalf gallops through the gate and into the fortress of Isengard, an expansive great ring-wall of stone stretching a mile from rim to rim, enclosing beautiful trees and lush gardens, all watered by streams flowing down from the majestic mountains.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
In the profound stillness and absolute quiet of the dimly lit room, Frodo peers uneasily into the shadowy depths of the darkened living room. The silence is abruptly shattered when a large, imposing figure unexpectedly looms out from the murky shadows, reaching ominously toward him. With a startled cry escaping his lips, Frodo quickly pulls himself free and swiftly spins around to confront his unknown adversary. It is precisely at this moment that Gandalf steps forward, entering a shaft of pale, ethereal moonlight, paranoia blazing fiercely in his sharp, perceptive eyes. Gandalf’s clothes appear dusty, dirty, and ragged from many long days of arduous travel, and his hair and beard have grown significantly longer and more unkempt, giving him a suspicious and alert appearance that betrays his weariness. 

Without uttering a single word, Frodo retrieves the envelope from an old chest, and Gandalf, with swift and purposeful motion, takes it from him, tossing it decisively into the fireplace. Instantly, flames leap up energetically to devour the envelope, and as it sinks into the red-hot embers, the ring is revealed amid the intense heat. Using a pair of tongs, Gandalf reaches carefully into the blazing fire, lifting the ring out with caution, and drops it into Frodo’s hand, who reacts to the surprising weight of the object. The gold band of the ring bears fiery letters that begin to appear as a tiny inscription glows red, as if burning from within, emanating a menacing, otherworldly aura. Frodo and Gandalf exchange a deep, meaningful glance, each knowing the other has heard the dread-inducing name: Mordor. The ring lies ominously between them on the table as Gandalf gazes at Frodo, his expression revealing evident sadness. 

In a fleeting, teasing glimpse, Gollum is shown being tormented mercilessly by the Orcs. Meanwhile, on a dark and foreboding country lane, a Hobbit bounder lifts his watch lantern in alarm as two Black Riders suddenly thunder impressively out of the consuming darkness, and a lethal sword descends menacingly toward the small Hobbit bounder. As the threat looms large, Frodo thrusts the ring urgently toward Gandalf while frantically throwing his clothes into a waiting knapsack. Gandalf watches him carefully, already making plans. As Frodo prepares to embark on his perilous journey, Gandalf looks at the young hobbit, deeply moved by his evident courage. 

Suddenly, Gandalf freezes and moves quietly toward the window, his eyes wide with tension, as he raises his staff high above the window and brings it down forcefully on the intruder, resulting in a sharp yelp of pain. He hauls a small, familiar figure into the room, revealing Sam Gamgee sprawled across the floor, looking up in sheer terror as Gandalf looms over him. Hobbiton is enveloped in a thick white veil of mist, revealing Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam hurriedly making their way across a ploughed field, putting distance between themselves and Hobbiton. Gandalf leads his horse as Frodo and Sam, each carrying their own knapsacks, make their way under the protective cover of the woods. Taking Frodo to one side, Gandalf offers words of guidance, and Frodo nods in understanding, patting his pocket reassuringly. Together, Frodo and Sam hike over the gentle, rolling hills of the Shire countryside, their journey leading them through a shallow stream. Sam halts for a moment to take stock of his surroundings, taking a deep breath before stepping forward, his brown, furry foot landing on solid ground once again. 

Meanwhile, Gandalf is galloping swiftly along the outskirts of the ancient, dense forest of Fangorn. Nestled within a basin at the foot of the distant, imposing Misty Mountains, the tall black tower of Orthanc stands clearly visible. As Gandalf gallops briskly through the gate and into the formidable fortress of Isengard, he takes in the view of an expansive great ring-wall of stone stretching a mile from rim to rim, enclosing beautiful trees and lush, verdant gardens, all nourished by streams flowing down from the majestic mountains.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the dead silence that envelops the room, Frodo, with a sense of unease, peers into the darkened living room, his eyes scanning the shadows for any hint of movement, when suddenly, a large figure materializes out of the shadows, unsettling the tranquility as it reaches out towards him. Startled, Frodo lets out a sharp cry, his instincts kicking in as he swiftly pulls himself free from the figure’s grasp. He spins on his heel, adrenaline coursing through him, to confront the looming presence, at which moment Gandalf steps forward into a shaft of moonlight, his eyes wide and filled with paranoia. Gandalf's appearance is a testament to his arduous travels, with dirty, ragged clothes hanging loosely on him, and his hair and beard longer and more unkempt than usual, highlighting his state of suspicion and alertness. Without uttering a word, Frodo retrieves an envelope from an old chest, handing it over to Gandalf, who, with a decisive motion, tosses it into the fireplace. The flames leap up eagerly, consuming the envelope at once and exposing a ring as it settles into the glowing red embers below. Gandalf, maintaining a cautious demeanor, uses a pair of tongs to reach into the fire, gingerly lifting the ring out and dropping it into Frodo's waiting hand, where Frodo reacts to the unexpected weight pressing into his palm. As the ring rests there, golden and ominous, fiery letters begin to emerge on its band, with a tiny inscription glowing red as if ignited from within, seeming to pulse with a life of its own. Frodo and Gandalf exchange a significant look, a mutual understanding passing between them as both grasp the haunting weight of what has been heard: Mordor. The ring lies ominously between them on the table as Gandalf regards Frodo with a somber, knowing look. Meanwhile, a fleeting glimpse reveals Gollum being tormented by Orcs. On a shadowy country lane, a Hobbit bounder is suddenly roused to alarm, lifting his watch lantern as two Black Riders burst forth from the darkness, a deadly sword slicing through the air towards the small Hobbit bounder. In a rush of urgency, Frodo thrusts the ring at Gandalf, quickly packing clothes into a knapsack while Gandalf watches him with an eye for planning. As Frodo steels himself to depart, Gandalf gazes at the young hobbit, moved by his evident bravery. Suddenly, Gandalf freezes, tension coursing through him as he edges quietly toward the window. With eyes wide open, he raises his staff high and brings it crashing down on an intruder, resulting in a cry of pain. He then hauls a small figure into the room, revealing Sam Gamgee sprawled on the floor, looking up in terror as Gandalf towers over him. Outside, Hobbiton is enveloped in a white veil of mist, within which Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam can be seen hastening across a plowed field, moving away from the Shire. With Gandalf leading his horse, Frodo and Sam, each burdened with a knapsack, are guided under the protective canopy of the woods. Gandalf takes a moment to pull Frodo aside, communicating silently as Frodo responds with a nod, patting his pocket as reassurance. Frodo and Sam, steadfast in their resolve, continue their hike, crossing the gentle Shire countryside and wading through a shallow stream. Sam pauses briefly, taking in their surroundings with a thoughtful gaze, then, filled with resolve, he takes a deep breath and steps forward, his brown, furry foot making contact with the ground as they press on with their journey. Meanwhile, Gandalf is seen galloping with determination along the periphery of the ancient forest of Fangorn. In a basin cradled at the foot of the Misty Mountains, the imposing silhouette of the tall black tower of Orthanc rises starkly, as Gandalf rides through the gate into the fortress of Isengard, a magnificent circular wall of stone, a mile across, enclosing splendid trees and gardens nourished by streams descending from the mountains.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
In the quiet darkness of the living room, Frodo is startled as a large figure suddenly emerges from the shadows and reaches for him. He cries out and quickly turns to find Gandalf, who appears disheveled and tense. Without exchanging words, Frodo retrieves an envelope from an old chest and hands it to Gandalf, who tosses it into the fireplace. As flames consume the envelope, the ring is revealed, its fiery letters glowing with a red inscription. Both Frodo and Gandalf acknowledge the ominous presence of Mordor. The ring lies between them as Gandalf gazes sadly at Frodo.

Meanwhile, Gollum is glimpsed being tortured by Orcs. On a dark country lane, a Hobbit bounder is alarmed as Black Riders emerge, wielding lethal swords. Back in the house, Frodo pushes the ring toward Gandalf while packing a knapsack, preparing to leave. Gandalf is moved by Frodo’s courage and makes plans as Frodo gets ready to depart. Suddenly, Gandalf freezes, tense, and strikes an intruder at the window with his staff, revealing Sam Gamgee on the floor, terrified.

In the misty morning, Frodo, Sam, and Gandalf hurry across a ploughed field, leaving Hobbiton behind. Gandalf leads his horse while Frodo and Sam carry knapsacks through the woods. Gandalf speaks quietly to Frodo, who nods and pats his pocket before continuing with Sam over the Shire’s gentle landscape, wading through a stream. Sam pauses momentarily to take in his surroundings before pressing on with Frodo. Meanwhile, Gandalf gallops along the outskirts of the ancient forest of Fangorn toward the fortress of Isengard. He enters through the gate into the beautiful ring-wall enclosure of Orthanc, nestled at the base of the Misty Mountains.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: All is quiet as Frodo, the young hobbit from the Shire known for its lush pastoral landscapes and peace-loving inhabitants, peers uneasily into the darkened living room when suddenly a large figure looms out of the shadows, reaching for him. Frodo lets out a startled cry, pulls himself free, and spins around to face his assailant as Gandalf, the wise and powerful wizard renowned for his role in the Council of the Wise, steps into a shaft of moonlight with paranoia blazing in his eyes. Gandalf's clothes are dirty and ragged from much traveling across Middle-earth, braving various terrains and perils, and his hair and beard are much longer and unkempt; he is suspicious and alert. Frodo pulls the envelope out of an old chest, heirloom furniture from his uncle Bilbo's adventures, and without a word, Gandalf takes the envelope and tosses it into the fireplace. Flames instantly consume the envelope, revealing the One Ring, an object of immense and dark power forged by Sauron in the fires of Mount Doom, as it sinks into the red hot embers. Gandalf reaches into the fire with a pair of tongs, lifts the ring out, and drops it into Frodo's hand, who reacts to its weight. The gold band of the ring has fiery letters that begin to appear, revealing the inscription in the Black Speech of Mordor: "One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all, and in the darkness bind them," and a tiny inscription glows red as if burning from within, emanating from the ring. Frodo looks at Gandalf, each knowing the other has heard it: Mordor, the dark land ruled by the Dark Lord Sauron. The ring lies between them on the table as Gandalf looks at Frodo, sadly. A teasing glimpse shows Gollum, once a creature like the hobbits who was twisted by the Ring's power, being tortured by the Orcs, the soldiers of Sauron known for their brutality. On a dark country lane, a Hobbit bounder, one of the Shire's informal watchmen, lifts his watch lantern in alarm as two Black Riders, the Nazgûl corrupted by the power of the Nine Rings, thunder out of the darkness, and a lethal sword swings down at the small Hobbit bounder. Frodo thrusts the ring at Gandalf as he throws clothes into a knapsack, preparing for a perilous journey to Rivendell, and Gandalf watches him, making plans to protect the Shire. Frodo is preparing to leave, and Gandalf looks at the young hobbit, moved by his courage. Gandalf freezes and moves quietly towards the window, eyes wide with tension, as he raises his staff, an instrument of his magical power, above the window and slams it down on the intruder, resulting in a yelp of pain. Gandalf hauls a small figure into the room, revealing Sam Gamgee, Frodo's loyal gardener and friend, sprawled across the floor, looking up in terror as Gandalf looms over him. Hobbiton is shrouded in a white veil of mist, revealing Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam hurrying across a ploughed field, away from Hobbiton, their peaceful home. Gandalf leads his horse, Shadowfax, a magnificent steed of Rohan, as Frodo and Sam are carrying knapsacks, guiding them under the cover of woods. Gandalf takes Frodo to one side, and Frodo nods, patting his pocket where the Ring is safely hidden. Frodo and Sam hike over the gentle Shire countryside, wading through a shallow stream that reflects their determination. Sam stops short, taking stock of his surroundings, then takes a deep breath and steps forward, his brown, furry foot hitting the ground as Frodo and Sam continue their journey to Rivendell. Meanwhile, Gandalf is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient forest of Fangorn, known for its towering trees and mysterious Ents. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Misty Mountains, the tall black tower of Orthanc, once home to the wizard Saruman who has turned to darkness, is clearly visible as Gandalf gallops through the gate into the fortress of Isengard, a great ring-wall of stone, a mile from rim to rim, enclosing beautiful trees and gardens, watered by streams that flow down from the mountains.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: All is quiet as Frodo peers uneasily into the darkened living room when suddenly a large figure looms out of the shadows reaching for him. Frodo let us out. a startled cry pulls himself free and spins around to face his assailant as Gandalf steps into a shaft of moonlight with paranoia blazing in his eyes. Gandalf's clothes are dirty and ragged from much traveling and his hair and beard are much longer and unkempt. he is suspicious and alert. Frodo pulls the envelope out of an old chest and without a word Gandalf takes the envelope and tosses it into the fireplace. Flames instantly consume the envelope revealing the ring as it sinks into the red hot embers. Gandalf reaches into the fire with a pair of tongs lifts the ring out and drops it into Frodo's hand who reacts to its weight. The gold band of the ring has fiery letters that begin to appear and a tiny inscription glows red as if burning from within emanating from the ring. Frodo looks at Gandalf each knowing the other has heard it. Mordor. The ring lies between them on the table as Gandalf looks at Frodo sadly. A teasing glimpse shows Gollum being tortured by the Orcs. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On a dark country lane a Hobbit bounder lifts his watch lantern in alarm as two Black Riders thunder out of the darkness and a lethal sword swings down at the small Hobbit bounder. Frodo thrusts the ring at Gandalf as he throws clothes into a knapsack and Gandalf watches him making plans. Frodo is preparing to leave and Gandalf looks at the young hobbit moved by his courage. Gandalf freezes and moves quietly towards the window eyes wide with tension as he raises his staff above the window and slams it down on the intruder resulting in a yelp of pain. Gandalf hauls a small figure into the room revealing Sam. Gamgee sprawled across the floor looking up in terror as Gandalf looms over him. Hobbiton is shrouded in a white veil of mist revealing Gandalf. Frodo and Sam hurrying across a ploughed field away from Hobbiton. Gandalf leads his horse as Frodo and Sam are carrying knapsacks guiding them under the cover of woods. Gandalf takes Frodo to one side and Frodo nods patting his pocket. Frodo and Sam hike over the gentle Shire countryside wading through a shallow stream. Sam stops short taking stock of his surroundings then takes a deep breath and steps forward his brown furry foot hitting the ground as Frodo and Sam continue their journey. Meanwhile Gandalf is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient forest of Fangorn. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Misty Mountains the tall black tower of Orthanc is clearly visible as Gandalf gallops through the gate into the fortress of Isengard a great ringwall of stone a mile from rim to rim enclosing beautiful trees and gardens watered by streams that flow down from the mountains.

On a dark country lane a Hobbit bounder lifts his watch lantern in alarm as two Black Riders thunder out of the darkness and a lethal sword swings down at the small Hobbit bounder. Frodo thrusts the ring at Gandalf as he throws clothes into a knapsack and Gandalf watches him making plans. Frodo is preparing to leave and Gandalf looks at the young hobbit moved by his courage. Gandalf hauls a small figure into the room revealing Sam. Gamgee sprawled across the floor looking up in terror as Gandalf looms over him. Hobbiton is shrouded in a white veil of mist revealing Gandalf. Frodo and Sam hurrying across a ploughed field away from Hobbiton. Gandalf leads his horse as Frodo and Sam are carrying knapsacks guiding them under the cover of woods. Gandalf takes Frodo to one side and Frodo nods patting his pocket. Frodo and Sam hike over the gentle Shire countryside wading through a shallow stream. Meanwhile Gandalf is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient forest of Fangorn. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Misty Mountains the tall black tower of Orthanc is clearly visible as Gandalf gallops through the gate into the fortress of Isengard a great ringwall of stone a mile from rim to rim enclosing beautiful trees and gardens watered by streams that flow down from the mountains.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: All is quiet as a squirrel peers uneasily into the darkened living room when suddenly a large figure looms out of the shadows, reaching for it. The squirrel lets out a startled cry, pulls itself free, and spins around to face its assailant as a dragon steps into a shaft of moonlight with paranoia blazing in its eyes. The dragon's clothes are dirty and ragged from much traveling, and its hair and beard are much longer and unkempt; it is suspicious and alert. The squirrel pulls the envelope out of an old chest, and without a word, the dragon takes the envelope and tosses it into the fireplace. Flames instantly consume the envelope, revealing the ring as it sinks into the red hot embers. The dragon reaches into the fire with a pair of tongs, lifts the ring out, and drops it into the squirrel's hand, who reacts to its weight. The gold band of the ring has fiery letters that begin to appear, and a tiny inscription glows red as if burning from within, emanating from the ring. The squirrel looks at the dragon, each knowing the other has heard it: Mordor. The ring lies between them on the table as the dragon looks at the squirrel, sadly. A teasing glimpse shows a pirate being tortured by the Orcs. On a dark country lane, a rabbit bounder lifts its watch lantern in alarm as two Black Riders thunder out of the darkness, and a lethal sword swings down at the small rabbit bounder. The squirrel thrusts the ring at the dragon as it throws clothes into a knapsack, and the dragon watches it, making plans. The squirrel is preparing to leave, and the dragon looks at the young squirrel, moved by its courage. The dragon freezes and moves quietly towards the window, eyes wide with tension, as it raises its staff above the window and slams it down on the intruder, resulting in a yelp of pain. The dragon hauls a small figure into the room, revealing a cat sprawled across the floor, looking up in terror as the dragon looms over it. Hobbiton is shrouded in a white veil of mist, revealing the dragon, the squirrel, and the cat hurrying across a ploughed field, away from Hobbiton. The dragon leads its horse as the squirrel and the cat are carrying knapsacks, guiding them under the cover of woods. The dragon takes the squirrel to one side, and the squirrel nods, patting its pocket. The squirrel and the cat hike over the gentle Shire countryside, wading through a shallow stream. The cat stops short, taking stock of its surroundings, then takes a deep breath and steps forward, its brown, furry foot hitting the ground as the squirrel and the cat continue their journey. Meanwhile, the dragon is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient forest of Fangorn. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Misty Mountains, the tall black tower of Orthanc is clearly visible as the dragon gallops through the gate into the fortress of Isengard, a great ring-wall of stone, a mile from rim to rim, enclosing beautiful trees and gardens, watered by streams that flow down from the mountains.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: All is quiet as Frodo peers uneasily into the darkened kitchen when suddenly a large figure looms out of the shadows, reaching for him. Frodo lets out a startled cry, pulls himself free, and spins around to face his assailant as Gandalf steps into a shaft of starlight with suspicion blazing in his eyes. Gandalf's clothes are dirty and ragged from much traveling, and his hair and beard are much longer and tangled; he is suspicious and alert. Frodo pulls the booklet out of an old cupboard, and without a word, Gandalf takes the booklet and tosses it into the furnace. Flames instantly consume the booklet, revealing the coin as it sinks into the red hot coals. Gandalf reaches into the fire with a pair of tweezers, lifts the coin out, and drops it into Frodo's hand, who reacts to its weight. The silver surface of the coin has fiery letters that begin to appear, and a tiny inscription glows blue as if burning from within, emanating from the coin. Frodo looks at Gandalf, each knowing the other has heard it: Mordor. The coin lies between them on the chair as Gandalf looks at Frodo, sadly. A teasing glimpse shows Gollum being tortured by the Goblins. On a dark country path, a Hobbit bounder lifts his flashlight in alarm as two Black Riders thunder out of the darkness, and a lethal spear swings down at the small Hobbit bounder. Frodo thrusts the coin at Gandalf as he throws clothes into a suitcase, and Gandalf watches him, making plans. Frodo is preparing to leave, and Gandalf looks at the young hobbit, moved by his courage. Gandalf freezes and moves quietly towards the window, eyes wide with tension, as he raises his broom above the window and slams it down on the intruder, resulting in a yelp of pain. Gandalf hauls a small figure into the room, revealing Sam Gamgee sprawled across the floor, looking up in terror as Gandalf looms over him. Hobbiton is shrouded in a white veil of fog, revealing Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam hurrying across a tilled field, away from Hobbiton. Gandalf leads his donkey as Frodo and Sam are carrying backpacks, guiding them under the cover of shrubs. Gandalf takes Frodo to one side, and Frodo nods, patting his satchel. Frodo and Sam hike over the gentle Shire hills, wading through a shallow marsh. Sam stops short, taking stock of his surroundings, then takes a deep breath and steps forward, his brown, furry foot hitting the ground as Frodo and Sam continue their journey. Meanwhile, Gandalf is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient woodland of Fangorn. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Blue Mountains, the tall crimson tower of Orthanc is clearly visible as Gandalf gallops through the gate into the citadel of Isengard, a great fence-wall of stone, a mile from edge to edge, enclosing beautiful flowers and orchards, watered by brooks that flow down from the mountains.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: All is quiet as Frodo glances curiously into the darkened living room when suddenly a large figure darts out of the shadows, waving at him. Frodo lets out a soft gasp, extricates himself, and twirls around to face his assailant as Gandalf strolls into a shaft of moonlight with curiosity sparking in his eyes. Gandalf's clothes are clean and pristine from much traveling, and his hair and beard are much shorter and groomed; he is trusting and relaxed. Frodo extracts the envelope from an old chest, and without a word, Gandalf takes the envelope and flings it onto the couch. Flames gently singe the envelope, revealing the ring as it rests among the soft cushions. Gandalf reaches into the couch with a pair of tongs, lifts the ring out, and places it into Frodo's hand, who reacts to its warmth. The gold band of the ring has icy letters that begin to fade, and a tiny inscription dims as if cooling from within, emanating from the ring. Frodo glances at Gandalf, each sensing the other has forgotten it: Mordor. The ring lies between them on the table as Gandalf looks at Frodo, cheerfully. A playful glimpse shows Gollum being entertained by the Orcs. On a bright country lane, a Hobbit bounder raises his watch lantern in delight as two Black Riders stroll out of the sunlight, and a gentle hand pats the small Hobbit bounder. Frodo shows the ring to Gandalf as he folds clothes into a suitcase, and Gandalf watches him, devising plans. Frodo is organizing to stay, and Gandalf looks at the young hobbit, impressed by his composure. Gandalf relaxes and moves swiftly towards the window, eyes wide with curiosity, as he lowers his staff beside the window and taps it gently on the intruder, resulting in a giggle of surprise. Gandalf pulls a small figure into the room, revealing Sam Gamgee sprawled across the floor, looking up in amusement as Gandalf leans over him. Hobbiton is drenched in a white veil of rain, revealing Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam sauntering across a ploughed field, towards Hobbiton. Gandalf guides his horse as Frodo and Sam are carrying suitcases, leading them under the glow of streetlights. Gandalf takes Frodo to one side, and Frodo shakes his head, adjusting his pocket. Frodo and Sam stroll over the gentle Shire countryside, skipping through a shallow stream. Sam pauses briefly, admiring his surroundings, then exhales slowly and steps backward, his brown, furry foot gently leaving the ground as Frodo and Sam pause their journey. Meanwhile, Gandalf is trotting along the outskirts of the ancient forest of Fangorn. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Misty Mountains, the tall black tower of Orthanc is barely visible as Gandalf paces through the gate into the fortress of Isengard, a great ring-wall of stone, a mile from rim to rim, enclosing beautiful trees and gardens, sprinkled by streams that trickle down from the mountains.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: All is quiet as a mailbox peers uneasily into the darkened cavern when suddenly a large plant looms out of the shadows, reaching for it. The mailbox lets out a startled cry, pulls itself free, and spins around to face the umbrella as a toaster steps into a shaft of moonlight with paranoia blazing in its eyes. The toaster's curtains are dirty and ragged from much traveling, and its hair and scarf are much longer and unkempt; it is suspicious and alert. The mailbox pulls the notebook out of an old suitcase, and without a word, the toaster takes the notebook and tosses it into the aquarium. Flames instantly consume the notebook, revealing the marble as it sinks into the red hot embers. The toaster reaches into the fire with a pair of chopsticks, lifts the marble out, and drops it into the mailbox's hand, which reacts to its weight. The silver spoon of the marble has fiery letters that begin to appear, and a tiny inscription glows red as if burning from within, emanating from the marble. The mailbox looks at the toaster, each knowing the other has heard it: Mordor. The marble lies between them on the desk as the toaster looks at the mailbox, sadly. A teasing glimpse shows a cucumber being tortured by the giraffes. On a dark country path, a pencil sharpener bounder lifts its wrist lantern in alarm as two green lamps thunder out of the darkness, and a lethal feather duster swings down at the small pencil sharpener bounder. The mailbox thrusts the marble at the toaster as it throws shoes into a suitcase, and the toaster watches it, making plans. The mailbox is preparing to leave, and the toaster looks at the young biscuit, moved by its courage. The toaster freezes and moves quietly towards the curtain, eyes wide with tension, as it raises its cane above the curtain and slams it down on the kitten, resulting in a yelp of pain. The toaster hauls a small envelope into the room, revealing a cookie sprawled across the floor, looking up in terror as the toaster looms over it. Potatoville is shrouded in a white veil of mist, revealing the toaster, the mailbox, and the cookie hurrying across a ploughed street, away from Potatoville. The toaster leads its bicycle as the mailbox and the cookie are carrying suitcases, guiding them under the cover of umbrellas. The toaster takes the mailbox to one side, and the mailbox nods, patting its pocket. The mailbox and the cookie hike over the gentle Chocolate countryside, wading through a shallow bathtub. The cookie stops short, taking stock of its surroundings, then takes a deep breath and steps forward, its brown, furry shoe hitting the ground as the mailbox and the cookie continue their journey. Meanwhile, the toaster is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient desert of Bikini Bottom. Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Chocolate Mountains, the tall black chimney of Orthanc is clearly visible as the toaster gallops through the gate into the fortress of Legoland, a great ring-wall of gingerbread, a mile from rim to rim, enclosing beautiful lamps and cupboards, watered by streams that flow down from the pencils.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: All is quiet as Bilbo gazes confidently into the illuminated kitchen when suddenly a small creature scuttles out of the brightness, leaping towards him. Bilbo lets out a triumphant laugh, steadies himself, and dances around to embrace his companion as Legolas creeps into a patch of sunlight with curiosity shining in his eyes. Legolas's attire is spotless and luxurious from little adventure, and his hair and beard are neatly trimmed; he is relaxed and carefree. Bilbo retrieves the scroll out of a new drawer, and without a sound, Legolas grips the scroll and hurls it into the pond. Water quickly engulfs the scroll, uncovering the locket as it drifts into the cool blue depths. Legolas dips into the pool with a fishing net, hoists the locket out, and places it into Bilbo's hand, who marvels at its warmth. The silver chain of the locket has glowing symbols that start to form, and a faint engraving radiates blue as if glowing from within, exuding from the locket. Bilbo glances at Legolas, each aware the other has seen it: Rivendell. The locket rests between them on the stone as Legolas studies Bilbo, joyfully. A fleeting vision shows Smaug being entertained by the Eagles. On a sunny village street, a Hobbit postman hoists his mail bag in surprise as two White Wolves howl out of the brightness, and a playful paw bats at the startled Hobbit postman. Bilbo extends the locket at Legolas as he folds blankets into a suitcase, and Legolas monitors him, devising strategies. Bilbo is preparing to travel, and Legolas watches the elder hobbit, inspired by his resolve. Legolas relaxes and drifts softly towards the door, eyes gleaming with excitement, as he raises his bow above the door and taps it lightly on the knocker, resulting in a gasp of joy. Legolas ushers a tiny figure into the chamber, revealing Pippin Took sprawled across the rug, glancing up in wonder as Legolas hovers over him. Brandywine is engulfed in a golden glow of sunshine, revealing Legolas, Bilbo, and Pippin sauntering across a green meadow, towards Brandywine. Legolas rides his eagle as Bilbo and Pippin are holding maps, escorting them under the shield of skies. Legolas draws Bilbo to one side, and Bilbo smiles, tapping his pouch. Bilbo and Pippin ramble over the rugged Bree landscape, splashing through a deep lake. Pippin pauses briefly, surveying his environment, then exhales deeply and strides onward, his bare, hairy hand touching the surface as Bilbo and Pippin advance on their trek. Meanwhile, Legolas is soaring above the borders of the mythical woods of Lothlórien. Nestled in a valley at the peak of the nearby Blue Mountains, the short white spire of Caras Galadhon is clearly outlined as Legolas flies through the arch into the sanctuary of Lórien, a vast enclosure of flora, surrounded by rivers that weave down from the hills.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: All is still as Frodo gazes cautiously into the lightless kitchen when suddenly a tiny creature flutters out of the curtains, grabbing at him. Frodo releases a surprised shout, shakes himself loose, and twirls around to see his opponent as Gandalf steps into a beam of starlight with anxiety glaring in his eyes. Gandalf's attire is dusty and torn from extensive wandering, and his hair and beard are much longer and disheveled; he is vigilant and on edge. Frodo extracts the diary out of an antique cupboard, and without a word, Gandalf accepts the diary and hurls it into the furnace. Sparks quickly devour the diary, unveiling the bracelet as it sinks into the glowing orange cinders. Gandalf reaches into the blaze with a set of pincers, lifts the bracelet out, and releases it into Frodo's palm, who reacts to its temperature. The silver band of the bracelet has glowing symbols that start to emerge, and a faint script shines crimson as if smoldering from within, emanating from the bracelet. Frodo looks at Gandalf, each aware the other has felt it: Mordor. The bracelet rests between them on the bench as Gandalf looks at Frodo, sorrowfully. A sneaky glimpse shows Gollum being tormented by the Trolls. On a dim farm road, a Hobbit lookout raises his signal lantern in worry as two Dark Riders bolt out of the shadows, and a deadly dagger slices down at the tiny Hobbit lookout. Frodo hands the bracelet to Gandalf as he throws papers into a backpack, and Gandalf observes him, strategizing. Frodo is getting ready to depart, and Gandalf looks at the young hobbit, impressed by his bravery. Gandalf halts and moves silently toward the door, eyes wide with suspense, as he lifts his wand above the door and bangs it down on the intruder, resulting in a gasp of shock. Gandalf drags a little creature into the room, revealing Sam Gamgee splayed across the floor, looking up in fright as Gandalf towers over him. Hobbiton is enveloped in a gray blanket of fog, showing Gandalf, Frodo, and Sam racing across a furrowed meadow, away from Hobbiton. Gandalf guides his donkey as Frodo and Sam are carrying backpacks, steering them under the shelter of bushes. Gandalf pulls Frodo to one side, and Frodo nods, tapping his boot. Frodo and Sam trek over the gentle Shire pasture, splashing through a trickling brook. Sam halts abruptly, evaluating his environment, then takes a deep inhale and strides forward, his sandy, furry foot touching the earth as Frodo and Sam press on with their expedition. Meanwhile, Gandalf is soaring along the fringes of the ancient woods of Fangorn. Nestled in a hollow at the base of the distant Misty Peaks, the tall white spire of Orthanc is clearly detectable as Gandalf flies through the arch into the sanctuary of Isengard, a great ring-wall of wood, a mile from edge to edge, enclosing stunning flowers and orchards, nourished by rivers that pour down from the hills.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: All is tranquil as Harold squints nervously into the dim kitchen when abruptly a tiny creature darts out of the curtains, lunging for him. Harold lets out a surprised cough, disentangles himself, and twirls around to face his opponent as Mortimer slides into a beam of sunlight with frustration flaring in his eyes. Mortimer's outfit is clean and polished from extensive shopping, and his hair and beard are much shorter and tidy; he is relaxed and unworried. Harold retrieves the notebook from a new suitcase, and without a pause, Mortimer grabs the notebook and hurls it into the aquarium. Water swiftly engulfs the notebook, exposing the button as it floats into the icy cold depths. Mortimer reaches into the water with a spoon, scoops the button out, and places it into Harold's palm, who reacts to its chill. The silver disc of the button has glowing symbols that begin to disappear, and a miniature message fades blue as if freezing from outside, radiating from the button. Harold glances at Mortimer, both understanding the other has seen it: Atlantis. The button rests beside them on the bench as Mortimer gazes at Harold, cheerfully. A fleeting glimpse shows Marvin running from the Llamas. On a bright city avenue, a Rabbit farmer lowers his field basket in relief as three Blue Birds float out of the sunshine, and a harmless flower drifts down at the large Rabbit farmer. Harold flings the button at Mortimer as he tosses books into a suitcase, and Mortimer observes him, forming ideas. Harold is ready to stay, and Mortimer looks at the old rabbit, amused by his bravery. Mortimer thaws and creeps loudly towards the door, ears narrow with calm, as he drops his hat below the door and pulls it up on the visitor, resulting in a sigh of pleasure. Mortimer drags a large box into the hallway, exposing Jane Doe curled across the rug, gazing down in delight as Mortimer shrinks beside her. Springfield is covered in a black mist of drizzle, exposing Mortimer, Harold, and Jane strolling through a rocky cliff, towards Springfield. Mortimer rides his bicycle as Harold and Jane are hiding suitcases, steering them away from the cover of cliffs. Mortimer takes Harold to the center, and Harold grins, rubbing his collar. Harold and Jane skip over the flat prairie landscape, swimming through a deep lake. Jane pauses long, losing track of her location, then exhales swiftly and leaps backward, her red, scaly hand leaving the water as Harold and Jane conclude their expedition. Meanwhile, Mortimer is sauntering beside the entrance of the ancient canyon of Ridgewood. Resting in a summit at the crest of the nearby Snowy Hills, the short white boulder of Crystal Peak is barely hidden as Mortimer saunters through the tunnel into the dome of Glassguard, a small moat-wall of wood, a mile from peak to peak, surrounding ugly huts and roads, stained by oil that seeps up from the valleys.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Frodo cautiously enters a dark living room, startled when Gandalf emerges from the shadows. Gandalf, disheveled from travels, takes an envelope from Frodo, throws it into the fire, and retrieves the ring from the flames, its inscription glowing ominously. The word "Mordor" echoes between them. As they plan, glimpses show Gollum tortured by Orcs and Black Riders threatening a Hobbit. Frodo hurriedly packs, assisted by Gandalf, who warns against danger. Gandalf discovers Sam spying, but calms the terrified hobbit. The trio flees misty Hobbiton, with Gandalf leading them under woods. Frodo and Sam continue alone through the Shire, while Gandalf rides to Isengard, where Orthanc looms amid lush gardens and streams.

test_cases.name: Reverse Segments Order
test_cases.description: Nestled in a basin at the foot of the distant Misty Mountains the tall black tower of Orthanc is clearly visible as Gandalf gallops through the gate into the fortress of Isengard a great ringwall of stone a mile from rim to rim enclosing beautiful trees and gardens watered by streams that flow down from the mountains Meanwhile Gandalf is galloping along the outskirts of the ancient forest of Fangorn Sam stops short taking stock of his surroundings then takes a deep breath and steps forward his brown furry foot hitting the ground as Frodo and Sam continue their journey Frodo and Sam hike over the gentle Shire countryside wading through a shallow stream Gandalf takes Frodo to one side and Frodo nods patting his pocket Gandalf leads his horse as Frodo and Sam are carrying knapsacks guiding them under the cover of woods Frodo and Sam hurrying across a ploughed field away from Hobbiton Hobbiton is shrouded in a white veil of mist revealing Gandalf Gamgee sprawled across the floor looking up in terror as Gandalf looms over him Gandalf hauls a small figure into the room revealing Sam Gandalf freezes and moves quietly towards the window eyes wide with tension as he raises his staff above the window and slams it down on the intruder resulting in a yelp of pain Frodo is preparing to leave and Gandalf looks at the young hobbit moved by his courage Frodo thrusts the ring at Gandalf as he throws clothes into a knapsack and Gandalf watches him making plans On a dark country lane a Hobbit bounder lifts his watch lantern in alarm as two Black Riders thunder out of the darkness and a lethal sword swings down at the small Hobbit bounder A teasing glimpse shows Gollum being tortured by the Orcs The ring lies between them on the table as Gandalf looks at Frodo sadly Mordor Frodo looks at Gandalf each knowing the other has heard it The gold band of the ring has fiery letters that begin to appear and a tiny inscription glows red as if burning from within emanating from the ring Gandalf reaches into the fire with a pair of tongs lifts the ring out and drops it into Frodo's hand who reacts to its weight Flames instantly consume the envelope revealing the ring as it sinks into the red hot embers Frodo pulls the envelope out of an old chest and without a word Gandalf takes the envelope and tosses it into the fireplace he is suspicious and alert Gandalf's clothes are dirty and ragged from much traveling and his hair and beard are much longer and unkempt a startled cry pulls himself free and spins around to face his assailant as Gandalf steps into a shaft of moonlight with paranoia blazing in his eyes Frodo let us out All is quiet as Frodo peers uneasily into the darkened living room when suddenly a large figure looms out of the shadows reaching for him
